page.title: 13LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Mr and Mrs Coupland have lived in Peacehaven since 1937. Mr Coupland talked about the tidal wave at the Bastion Steps in the early 1950's.Some people were swept into the sea causing the deaths of a few people. They told how a lot of children were evacuated to Canada by boat during the war.Mrs Coupland said that her neighbour's children were evacuated. Where the Meridian Centre now stands was afavourite place to have a picnic and to pick blackberries. The cliffs at Peacehaven used to be full of small indentations and covered in daffodils but to combat erosion they were straightened and all the daffodils lost.
